reason:
q <-> q^{-1} SYMMETRY CONTRADICTS Vol_hyp SIGN CLAIMS:

The node claims: For q > 1, Vol_hyp > 0 giving exponential growth; for 0 < q < 1, Vol_hyp < 0 giving exponential decay.

This is contradicted by the q <-> q^{-1} symmetry of quantum 6j symbols:

MATHEMATICAL ARGUMENT: The quantum integer [n]_q = (q^n - q^{-n})/(q - q^{-1}) is manifestly INVARIANT under q -> q^{-1}, because replacing q by q^{-1} gives (q^{-n} - q^n)/(q^{-1} - q) = (q^n - q^{-n})/(q - q^{-1}) = [n]_q. The quantum factorial [n]_q! = [1]_q [2]_q ... [n]_q is therefore also invariant. The quantum 6j symbol is defined (Kirillov-Reshetikhin) as a finite sum of products and quotients of q-factorials, with each term being a product of [n]_q! values. Since every [n]_q! is invariant under q -> q^{-1}, the entire 6j symbol satisfies:

{j1 j2 j3; j4 j5 j6}_q = {j1 j2 j3; j4 j5 j6}_{q^{-1}}

CONSEQUENCE: If the claimed formula |{6j}_q| ~ exp(n * Vol_hyp(q)) held, then Vol_hyp(q) = Vol_hyp(q^{-1}) for all q > 0. But the node claims Vol_hyp > 0 for q > 1 and Vol_hyp < 0 for 0 < q < 1. Since q > 1 implies q^{-1} < 1, this means Vol_hyp(q) > 0 and Vol_hyp(q^{-1}) < 0 simultaneously, contradicting Vol_hyp(q) = Vol_hyp(q^{-1}).

THEREFORE: The dichotomy claimed in the node -- exponential growth for q > 1 vs exponential decay for 0 < q < 1 -- is MATHEMATICALLY IMPOSSIBLE for the standard quantum 6j symbol. Either Vol_hyp > 0 for both q and q^{-1}, or Vol_hyp < 0 for both, or the asymptotic formula itself is wrong for real q > 0.
